39036575.review:
I just finish my first pass on this Visual Novel and i must say a few things.  I will keep it short;

1- The Art is different and refreshing from the Manga type of anime we normally see.  This style is more 'realistic'.  At first i wasn't sure i was going to appreciate it, but i did.   it gives the VN a sort of grounding and seriousness that make you quickly think this is not 'just' a game.

2- I quickly became attached to all the caracters in the story.  Although they sometimes feel shallow, it is normally in order to make the story logical depending on your choices you makes.  So i did accept this and i was fine with it as the story unfold.

3- The greatness in a story is when it keep your interrest all the way.  This novel did.  I mostly enjoyed every conversation (9/10) between the protagonist and the other caracters.

4- The descriptions of love scene are very well done and the CGs that goes with them 'fix' the moment very well.  I loved the art of this.  I felt the scene and that is a sign of great writing.  Don't expect them to be 3x though, since that part is left to your imagination.

5- Personaly i found the music to be totally nice and adequate to support what was happening.

6- Sound effect could have been more present but what is here is good quality and again support very well the action that is happening.

7- It is not a very long story, i have a 7 hours first pass at it.  Perfect for a rainy day or cold day.

8- Like when you get out of a good movie, i wish i could have see more.  That is a sign of a good VN.

All in All;

I GIVE A 8/10  for a 15$ purchase
if you can get it for less than 10$, this is one not to miss!!!  ;)

38924923.review:
I first saw this VN on YouTube and watched two of the endings play out on there (Lyria's and Scherza's). Normally I'd be satisfied with that and move on to the next thing I wanted to watch or play, but not this time. Starlight Vega captured my attention first with its art style. It's got a looser artistic style than most other VNs I've read. At first I wasn't sure if that'd leave me with a negative opinion of the visuals, but it didn't. If anything, I think it really added to the VN in some way I can't quite put my finger on -- perhaps by adding a certain level of charm and grace -- but it fits. The harem endign CG doesn't save due to a glitch of some sort, so if you want that on hand then be sure to either screenshot it or make a save right before/during the scene with that CG. On the topic of the CGs, they're all beautiful. There is one in Scherza's route that looks unfinished as it doesn't have the same level of shading as any other scene does (CG or not), but it's still well done.

The soundtrack is great and hasn't ever felt like it wasn't in sync with the moment. It's got a more of a classic and acoustic sound to it overall than being heavy on electronics, which works especially well with the story being told. During more intense moments of action there's a more electronic beat which, while it works in the moment, overal sounds a little out of place with the rest of the soundtrack. Yet since it fits with the moments it plays during it can be shrugged off in spite of being a noticeable change. Even the main title screen music is great and catchy. I do wish there had been a track similar to it used somewhere in the story itself, but what's there already is already lovely.

Speaking of, the story is fantastic. Sure, it can be boiled down to girl finds strange book, meets demons, goes to their world, but what really brings the story to life are the characters themselves each with their own unique personality. Depending on the ending you go for, some characters get less screen time than others, but that's to be expected. It's definitely worth going through the VN multiple times for different endings to really get a feel for what each character is like. Of the characters, Scherza's won me over the most. The one thing that struck me as a little odd was the portrait for Aria's mother as she's always looking away, off into the distance, rather than at Aria/the player, so it felt a little strange to see her on screen. She's doesn't show up too much though so it's an oddity that can be overlooked.

The writing is straight forward, nothing overly eloquent sounding -- nothing superfluous -- plain, you could say, but not without finese. It's not uncommon for me to sometimes start skimming while reading VNs, but not with this one. Starlight Vega held my attention from beginning to end without my interest dwindling even after the first playthrough of it.

The soundtrack, characters, and the choices you make where each causes a clear impact and change on the story's direction, all come together to tell a beautifully written story with loveable characters, and strong soundtrack to accompany it and further set the mood of the scenes.

I'd absolutely recommend this VN, it's one of my favorites. If you aren't certain about whether you want to get Starlight Vega or not, wait until it's on sale. It's worth the money either way and since it has seven outcomes, and with the achievements scattered between the majority of the routes, there's absolutely replay value for the completionists and even for those who want to see how the different routes pan out as the changes are significant between each route taken. It's also worthwhile to play through at least every individual character's good ending to get the full depth of the story as well. The harem ending is more for the fun of it being a harem conclusion.

If you're feeling unsure about getting Starlight Vega at full price then wait until it's on sale as it may feel like you don't have to expect quite as much if you get it then than at full price (though the VN is still very much worth full price to me as well). I will state that I got Starlight Vega on sale, but I wouldn't mind spending the full amount on it since I know I'm going to go back and read it again even though I've gone through the endings already.

38761455.review: I felt compelled to write a review of this game simply for how well put together I thought it was. Starlight Vega offers its readers a rich storyline with multiple endings like a classic VN choice based game. However, what really set it apart was the finease in the lines the story took with the choices you make, leaving the reader with genuine twists and turn on even the second playthough. The player will latch onto and become connected to a character within the game and want to know what happens to them (protagnoist or not), and that hook is what I think makes a great VN game and one I want to see to 100% competion. 38189278.review:
[h1] 两个人的海角天涯	[/h1]

（由于本人只通且只想通melody路线，故本评测带有强烈的主观色彩，请注意）

  Starlight Vega（中译：星光织女星）是一款典型的欧美百合向视觉小说。虽然画风可能有些人不能接受（女主母亲的立绘一上来差点把我劝退），但因此错过一部优秀的百合gal实在是太可惜了。

  我这个人虽然很喜欢视觉小说，尤其是百合向的视觉小说，但说实话，近年来我玩的VN是越来越少了。生活中的压力让我变得浮躁，越来越倾向于快节奏的游戏，很难得静下心来玩VN了。

作为为数不多的能让我一口气通关的VN，starlight vega对我而言自然是极具魅力的。原生的英文阅读流畅，画风除了女主她妈和她祖父以外看多了你就习惯了，我个人还蛮喜欢的。

  选择支很丰富给玩家提供了多种展开的可能性，虽然有些让我隐隐地感到一丝恶意（为什么和melody在一起后还会有反悔去和lyria好的选项!!!不要虐我melody啊!!!）当然最优秀的当然还是剧本。

 melody是女主的闺蜜，转到女主班上后因为邻座的女主主动打招呼聊天而慢慢成为朋友，逐渐日久生情喜欢上善良的女主（走melody路线的话你会发现当时女主就有好感想和melody交朋友所以主动亲近，看来本来这事就有戏）。melody美丽温柔，为女主的事情一直在忙碌。她是个对超自然很热衷的人，喜欢阅读，对古老的事物和发现新事物都很有兴趣，是故事发展的重要因素。
  
  melody路线可以用“好想急死你”来形容（我一开始以为不去展开超自然剧情，避免lyria的出现就能稳走melody路线了，结果直接跳end…看来没个推动还真难走到一起）。

  强势直白的外星女lyria的出现给了暗恋女主的melody巨大的危机感，所以她一开始对lyria颇不客气，自己一个人埋头为女主的事劳碌，期间还得听女主一遍又一遍地说“你是我的好朋友”。吃lyria醋的时候大多会忍着自己难过，女主担心她时又不敢说。

  melody路线里女主其实相当多的地方都能看出对melody的好感，不仅夸melody漂亮就有很多次，遇到事情会想念melody，连“奇怪的想法”有时都会冒出来（这里很多糖!）。只是前期两个人一个懵懵懂懂搞不清自己的情感，另一个支支吾吾掩饰自己，好不容易鼓起一次勇气最后还逃了，真是太让人着急。

  melody路线中lyria的存在非常强，作为一切故事的缘由，lyria开放不掩饰的性格堪称melody的天敌。前期床咚女主，后期得知女主和melody在一起后强吻女主。最初我很不喜欢lyria，不过后期她有情有义的表现改变了我的看法。
  
 拯救女主，当女王答应了条件要牺牲melody拯救星球时站出来对抗姐姐并拯救情敌，后期也显得很洒脱，最后甚至和melody改善了关系。那句对melody说的“你要照顾好她”让我感慨不已。

  祖父是彻头彻尾的反派角色，前期一个神龙见首不见尾，甚至颇受憧憬的人物却那样自私自利，让人寒心。女王虽然是为了自己的子民，后面也和好了，但总让人觉得不舒坦。反观lyria的小使魔（其实是女王的），被melody感动后不顾女王命令对祖父动手和lyria一起保护melody，很让人感动。

  melody是个优秀的人，她的美丽让女主还没意识到感情时就被其吸引。她可以原谅欺骗了她更把她送到外星的小使魔，让那个整天抱怨着“最讨厌人类”的家伙不惜反抗主人的命令去保护她，称她为最喜欢的人类（melody小天使!!!）。她可以体谅女王决定牺牲她的苦衷，可以和情敌lyria成为朋友。

 melody是才华横溢的，她记忆力优秀，能很快明白并尝试掌握超自然力量（melody熟练后第一个魔法就是传送到女主身边方便晚上一起睡，haha）她可以流利地进行双语转译。几年后她甚至可以稳定地建立通往织女星的传送，按理说这时她完全可以和女主过小日子不管织女星的事情，可她喜欢那个新世界，想念自己的朋友，对女王没有恨，和一辈子情敌lyria的关系也变得友善了。她甚至感谢织女星让女主和她走到了一起。melody宽容，不自私，重视友谊，对爱执着坚定。

  starlight vega的剧本扎实，感情发展平稳合理，心里描写非常出彩。（melody线就算在一起了后面还好几个跌宕起伏，稍稍有点虐不过剧情把控得不错不算喂药）。

  一开始是女主迟钝，不知道为什么melody情绪不稳定，lyria都吐槽“melody她还真是辛苦了”。还好因为意外女主看到了melody的记忆加上lyria的助攻明白了自己的感情（lyria都看不下去了喂），melody也不知道是不是被女主膝枕枕晕了头，紧要关头还来“不知道你看到了什么但可能有误会”这套，还好女主这时已经坚定了一发告白解决问题，然后就亲了个爽……咳咳。

  总的来说我非常喜欢melody路线啦，俗话说“陪伴是最长情的告白”，好闺蜜比起天降外星人甚至是外星王女还是更适合的。当然其他路线肯定会告诉我们其他两位女主的加分点和黑点，没玩的我自然不会妄加评论。不过怎么想那俩线肯定都要虐melody啊!（我讨厌后宫线，当然be线就更别提了）一想到melody默默付出那么多还得看着闺蜜被野女人拐跑我就累觉不爱了。我相信羁绊的力量不会输给天降系，我相信努力的人终获回报。

  [spoiler][strike] 谁反对melody我就打爆谁的狗头.jpg	[/strike] 	[/spoiler]

  几年后melody和女主搬出去住在公寓，女主努力工作，在背后默默支持着melody，melody能够稳定地打开空间通道与织女星的朋友们相会。过上了理想中平凡却又不平凡的生活，一起经历了风风雨雨的她们手牵着手，相视一笑。

  “无论是在地球还是在织女星，无论是平凡的日子还是超自然的事态--”
   
  “我都会陪着你，去到两个人的海角天涯”
    
   END

Even having played the demo, I was surprised by how much this game engaged me.  Looking at the store page I expected something relatively light and fluffy, but it's far more than that.  The main cast is small, but the characters are all well-realized and drew me in to their stories.  I never encountered anything off-putting, and always wanted to come back for more or to try different things.  The choices are numerous, and range from minor cumulative effects to opening brand new paths.

The only downsides are that one CG does not unlock, and there is no DLC like an artbook to let me contribute more to the developers for this project.  So if my review helps you decide to give this game a try, then I shall be satisfied to have done my part.

34389458.review: You don't get very much Yuri made for women, but Starlight vega is one of them. You play as Aria, who is your typical  teenager. She has three romance options, and she has lots of choices that influence the game and what ending you will get. Choices are varied and there is plently of these choices.  The story was engaging, and the setting really fit with the games overall narrative. Music was well done and the artsyle is unique and I quite liked it. Each character including Aria had a distinct personality and they all had some depth, and didn't feel one dimensional. The story ended with a great conclusion, and there is a decent amount of replayability. The only thing that was lacking was there was no voice acting, nor any dialog sound. Everything is silent, besides the background music and the occasional sound effects. Overall I highy recommend this to anyone a fan of Yuri romance or an enaging visual novel.

34350860.review:
Starlight Vega is a pretty straightforward romance VN with fantasy elements, offering around 10 hours of content when playing thought all the available paths. While it doesn’t do anything especially original, it tells an enjoyable story, with fairly serious and tasteful approach to relationship arcs and rather timid, but well thought-out eroticism. While it has love scenes, it’s presenting them with literary descriptions rather than explicit artwork (illustration stops at partial nudity) – the approach I very much appreciated.

The artwork in general and music, while somewhat simple, complement the story very well and some situational illustrations were a joy to look at, even though they weren’t super-heavy on details. The “indie” feel is very much present through the whole experience, but never gets in the way, even if sometimes I had a feeling that the writing could be better if a larger team worked on it. I think I’ve also seen rare misspellings and strange grammar. It wasn’t a major complain though and the story itself was very much gratifying – while short, it didn’t lack amusing dialogues, good character development and rewarded multiple playthroughs, uncovering new lore, showing the major story points from new angles depending on the player choices and offered a bunch of distinct endings.

One thing that made me wonder is the portrayal of yuri romance itself – while I think that the writing for the main character seemed solid and believable in most ways, her (and other female character’s) sexual attraction towards women is never explicitly mentioned/elaborated upon. As Aria is a high-schooler, she’s either atypically certain about her orientation or the writers just didn’t think to add that angle to the story – and I think it would benefit from it quite a lot. She seems uncertain about her feeling and don’t properly read her best friend Melody’s intentions, but the way it was presented in the story makes her feel just dense, rather than properly confused by her unusual feelings. Other than that I find all the characters rather interesting and having decent depth for such a short story (although it shows mostly if you follow their separate romance routes).

[b]In general, I’ve found this game very enjoyable and I can recommend it to anyone liking VNs or just looking for a nice romance story to read. I’ve bought it on -50% sale though and it felt like pretty much the right price for the content offered, $15 could have been a bit too much[/b].

34320765.review: It's not a perfect VN. The biggest issue that perhaps the final route is a disappointing patchwork of reused scenes and only a smattering of genuinely well-written, unique scenes. But taking the rest of the game into consideration, it's got solid writing and a very unique, attractive art style. Characters are all loveable in their own way. One of the most attractive well done aspects is that the all the love scenes are thoughtful, touching, and sexy without being gratuitous. Also, the music is pretty good. Would recommend if you like yuri VNs. The dev is also worth supporting.

31519409.review:
I play a lot of visual novels and, to be perfectly honest, I was skeptical about Starlight Vega. I wasn't sure it would live up to my standards. I was still hesitant when I took the plunge and bought it, but it came recommended by a friend, so I gave it a try.

In the end I don't regret a thing. I was impressed by the quality and will say that it was well worth the price.

The art is great. The characters are well designed and have satisfyingly expressive sprites, and the CG's are of great quality.

I enjoyed the story, or pehaps I should say stories. My choices always felt like they mattered, which is obviously a big plus for any game with multiple story paths. The routes all felt like they were developed equally, rather than there being some routes written significantly better than any others. The good endings all came to satisfactory conclusions, and resolved their problems differently, rather than having one main story path with "detours" depending on your choices.

The romance was tasteful (perhaps aside from one particular ending) and well executed, each girl felt different but all were pleasant.

I can heartily recommend Starlight Vega to anyone at all. It's a great starting point for those new to visual novels (or new to yuri), as well as a great visual novel for veterans who just want a fun read.

Note: There is partial nudity in the game, in the few scenes of... romantic stuff. (too tame to be described as a sex scene). Nothing much, but there will be a topless lady or two on some paths.

我花了六个晚上加一个下午的时间攻略成功三位女主包括通关后宫线，十一个成就解锁了十个，唯一剩下的那个，我死活都打不出来了，心有不甘，却无能为力。（本人英语渣，但这个游戏里的英文并不是很难理解，遣词造句也十分通俗易懂，出现的生词也会在后面的剧情里一再出现，玩的时候用上翻译基本能够明白整个剧情内容，easy to play）
好吧，废话不多说了，下面谈谈我的玩后感吧——
首先谈谈女主的闺蜜Melody，她是一位聪慧温柔，害羞腼腆的小姑娘，走她的专情线，你会感受到女主对她情感的转变。不得不说，看着两人的关系如何从朋友到恋人的蜕变是一个非常有趣的过程，当然女主的迟钝一度令我恨不能敲碎她的木鱼脑袋，所幸她喜欢的人也喜欢着她，双向暗恋sweet！
第二位出场的是魔女Lyria，她是一位热情奔放，方式直接的魅力女子。初次登场的时候，几乎一下子就吸引了我的注意，走她的路线估计是三位可攻略女主里最搞笑的一条线路了。通过女主对Lyria的深入了解，你会发现这位总是面带笑容，热情洋溢的女子也有忧伤的一面。（然而最后结局里她的表现却不怎么让我喜欢，个人看法罢了）
第三位也是整个游戏中最为神秘的女性——女王Scherza，她的出场方式比较奇特，通过梦境与女主产生联系，走她的专情路线，女主会主动帮她夺走魔法书之类的。其实从一开始，我一直以为Scherza是一个反面角色，但是通过走另外两名女主的路线你会渐渐发现她所做出的一切只不过是迫不得已罢了。毕竟她作为一名女王，在亲人离散，子民遭受诅咒，自己又无计可施的情况下会做出伤害其他人的行为都是情有可原的。
攻略Scherza的话，你将会看到一个真正的她，并没有她表面看上去的那么残酷冷漠，在面对女主的时候甚至会表露出她口是心非、傲娇的一面，总而言之，她是一个被塑造的很丰满的角色（唯一想吐槽的就是她和女主跳舞时的CG能不能不要那么敷衍啊QAQ）。
最后借用一下女主对女王Scherza的评价——她就像一朵带刺的玫瑰花，试图用自己的刺蛰伤所有靠近她的人。
（可千万不要被她忽冷忽热的态度吓跑哦~不然你会错过一位很可爱的恋人）

Point positifs :

- Les musiques, elles apportent un vrai plus au jeu
- 3 arcs avec chacun une bonne et une mauvaise fin (+ un dernier arc caché dispo que après avori fini les 3 premiers)

Points négatifs :
- Un style graphique peu commun qui pourrait ne pas plaire à tous

29188468.review:
This is a game I began with pretty high expectations, and ended up finishing as quickly as possible so I could get back to playing better games. [i]Starlight Vega[/i]’s plot, while not spectacular, could have made for a decent story if the characters’ writing had been strong. It isn’t. Everything in this visual novel feels flat, and falls flat. 

This is especially disappointing as Aria at first looks like a strong-willed protagonist, but in reality over half of her lines are just bland descriptions of her surroundings and of the people next to her, without any personal input that could give the reader some hints about her character and the way [b]she[/b] sees her new world (as she has just moved in a new house, where all the supernatural events unfold).

The game attempts to touch at political intrigue, but its obvious main appeal is romance, and if I were to find three phrases to describe it, it would be tedious, unconvincing and full of bad fanservice. The first two go hand in hand. The characters do not spend enough time together or don’t have any significant bonding moments/common traits that would justify the sudden feelings Aria has for her love interest (or is ‘she’s good-looking’ alone supposed to be convincing ?) And when they eventually kiss and declare their love for each other, the writing makes it feel so unrelatable I just couldn’t rejoice, empathise with the characters, find them cute or any other positive feeling. I would make an exception for Melody’s route, which was the better of the three and felt more solid to read, but unfortunately it still couldn’t shake off the boredom the game had brought about in me at this point.

Fanservice is my main problem with the game, though. If it just consisted of a few raunchy CGs, it’d be fine. The issue is, this game (and especially Lydia’s route, which I had the misfortune to play first) makes its plot unfold thanks to a certain amount of gross tropes you would traditionally see in some bad fanfiction, and not a game you have to actually pay for. Namely, Lydia can’t seem to stop herself from sexually assaulting the main character (who eventually returns her feelings despite this, [i]obviously[/i]), even after the latter makes it clear to her she isn’t interested in her advances (there is even an achievement for this scene, what the hell). I know it’s supposed to be sexy and to make the player want to pursue a romance with her, but I found it off-putting and it made me feel really uncomfortable, especially considering the fact it happens several times. The so-called harem ending is also terrible in that aspect, as it is out-of-character for at least half of the characters involved and a cheap excuse to show us a CG that doesn’t even appear in the gallery by the end.

The art is decent and probably the best aspect of the game, but it lacks polish and one cannot overlook the fact that the same backgrounds are repeatedly used for different locations and the sprites lack diversity. The music is forgettable.

Tl;dr: I’m saddened to be writing this kind of review for a f/f dating sim, as there are not so many of them, but [i]Starlight Vega[/i] being at best tedious to read and at worst trying to justify romance with creepy tropes and cheap feelings, I just can’t recommend it, especially if you’re LGBT+ and looking for good representation. And in hindsight, having seen the description of the developer’s next game, I should have known better than to play it.

28013026.review:
Wow, I usually don’t write reviews, but I kind of feel obliged to do so now, because this game deserves all the love it can get.
At first I was disappointed, because right from the beginning I knew which girl to follow [spoiler]Melody of course[/spoiler], but I neglected the other one, so after about an hour instead of finding true love I found myself a bad ending -.- About eight hours later I was again disappointed, because now I had run through all the dialogue options and had nothing more to explore. In between lay the most enjoyable gaming experience I had this year.

Especially compelling was the heartwarming combination of artwork and character design. Aria is a believable main character, whose rational distance to her own emotions and devotion to her friends make her really likeable. Her facial expressions were charming and fitting throughout the whole story. All the love interests played well together and I enjoyed the route of every single one of them. Their traits, design, interaction and the fantastical story made me truly care for them and I was happy, when the story proceeded happily and sad, when I got bad endings. The CGs are wonderful. This altogether created an affection of the higher kind for me, because I didn’t just feel for the characters in the game, but also felt the satisfaction of experiencing a subtle hint of the author’s own joy in creating them so diligently.

Music was pretty good too. The title theme was catchy and I found myself browsing through the CG sets to enjoy the tune some more. Rest of the music was also fitting despite being less memorable.
I also liked the right amount of sensitivity in the intimate scenes as well as the use of language for those and the story as a whole. A lot of thought was put in the narration, which made the novel a comfortable read.

I won’t deny that there are still some flaws. The male characters were in no way as charming as their female counterparts. The backgrounds were sometimes inappropriately repetitive. There are holes in the plot or at least some parts were not as well played out as they could have been [spoiler]the whole curse for example[/spoiler]. Some choices seem rather irrational, too (and my last achievement and the best CG are still locked -.-). But who cares, right? (maybe all the people who aren’t into demon yuri visual novels with choices…[strike]and those who can’t appreciate good games xp[/strike]

okay without personal bias I would still highly recommend this game, if you are open minded to Indie VN and Yuri, although maybe the flaws hit a bit harder here. And if for reasons unbeknownst to me you cannot connect with the characters, then maybe the art is all that’s left for you.

But with personal bias this game was just my cup of tea. 
10/10

Well done and thank you, Razzart!

PS: Harem rules!

25223290.review:
First of all, I backed this game on Kickstarter, so my impressions might be biased.

Things I did like:
+ overall art direction
+ love scenes were touching and feel integral to the story, unlike many other VNs

Things I didn't like:
- narrative is very broken between the scenes, it's like some scenes were built for a specific route, and then stitched together in other routes with no respect to overall flow in these specific transitions, so you'll see characters being very polar all the time
- some scene transitions make no sense: there's no transition at all between some disjointed scenes, with no lead up or explanation after the fact, so you'll be confused at times at what exactly is happening
- character motivations are very narrative-forced, especially in Scherza and Harem arcs
- overall plot twists are almost non-existent: you can take everything at face value and will not be mistaken; also, some endings a conflicting with in-universe laws that were established in other endings (one glaring example is for harem ending and traveling between worlds)
- consistency: all-ages CGs for love scenes often do not match quite explicit texts; also some random swears for no apparent reason in a couple of scenes
- very limited art selection for characters, as well as for backgrounds, even for key scenes (like, when Aria wearing a dress before the mishap, some backgrounds reused 3-4 times for different places); I don't demand completely new assets, but make some minor changes with details that reflect the narrative? Can we have at least 2 mom versions: for home and for school pickup, etc?
- music is ok, but it often doesn't match the scene, and overall there's no overarching theme to it
- also font is ... very unusual and not the easiest on the eyes

24248456.review:
An adorable indie yuri VN.  I backed it on Kickstarter not knowing what to expect, so when I finally got around to starting it a few days ago, I was delighted to find that it exceeded my expectations.  Starlight Vega is a lovely fantasy romance story with immediately likable (if somewhat arch) characters, a compelling and well-paced plot, an art style that strikes a nice balance between the standard anime style of many VNs and a sketchier "Western" style, and an appealing heroine who doesn't belabor the point in a misguided quest for "immersion" like so many VN protagonists do.

I really like that our humble narrator is visible in the corner of the screen and reacting to events with different expressions at almost all times, which gives us visual shorthand as to how she's feeling at any given moment.  That's a really smart piece of design other VNs would do well to steal.

My only complaints are all fairly slight and understandable given the budget, but they remain complaints nonetheless.  First of all, the music is good, but it has a slightly cheap and flat MIDI sound to it.  Secondly, there are a few points where the game's reach exceeds its grasp visually (mostly combat scenes), and a few other points where a character picture seems conspicuously absent.  Third, while there are several significant choices (including one that changes the game rather substantially right at the beginning), the extensive reuse of art assets makes different playthroughs feel more similar than they should.

Still, this is a terrific game, and I'd love a sequel.

23754032.review:
I've just finished the game, and it's not worth the price. 

Don't get me wrong; it isn't a terrible game.  As far as visual novels go, it isn't too bad.  The soundtrack is mostly forgettable.  The best thing about this visual novel was the art, I think. 

Let's start with the basics; character and plot.  The characters, as most characters go, are fairly cliche; that's nothing too bad, though.  It's really difficult to come up with original characters nowadays; what matters more is what you do with them.  The protagonist caught my interest; while nothing innovative, she is a solid and relatable female lead, somewhat intelligent and quirky enough to keep my interest. 

The supporting cast is much of the same; all are somewhat interesting.  

But one of the biggest problems of this VN are revealed; every single character is shallow.  None of the characters have much background at all, only that which is immediately relevant to the plot.  While that isn't normally a bad thing, this ties in to a major failing of the plot, but we'll get to that later.

So the characters aren't anything special.  I won't remember this VN in a week.  There isn't anything particularly memorable about this.

Moving on to the plot and general play.  Don't be fooled by my time; this VN only has about 6 hours of playthrough; I spent the other six AFK.  There's really not much playability in this despite there being four different routes and about eight different endings.  At $15 USD, that's a fairly hefty price as far as games go.  There are quite a few few VNs out there with much more playability, so expect to eat through this fairly quickly.  

The routes and options don't always make sense.  The [spoiler]secret harem[/spoiler] route, for example, is out of character for at least two of the characters.  And while we're talking about love and plot, well, we should note that there are so few interactions between characters, relatively, that it's hard to believe that enough time has passed for the protagonist to love any of the characters.  The only one that makes sense is the Melody route, since they've been friends for a while, but the protagonist's thoughts on love are done awkwardly.  The fact that there isn't really a sense of time to the story when they [spoiler]go to Vega[/spoiler] doesn't help. 

There's extremely limited backstory to the game; only what matters to the plot is talked about, and that creates a sense of shallowness and disconnect that makes it hard to really feel.  Outside of the story, the characters really are relatively normal...and while that helps us relate a little, it also means that we aren't really emotionally invested in them.  

Much of the [spoiler]Vega[/spoiler] portion of the game, I think, could've been written better, especially in regards to [spoiler]the curse.[/spoiler]  Everything happens in a relaxed manner despite the urgency of the situation and what could have easily been an emotionally deep tale just feels boring and mundane.  

The climax of the story is atrociously dull; the only route that intrigued me was, again, Melody's route, because there was a little bit, and JUST a little bit, of emotional suspense.  The story itself already indicated that all of the characters had [spoiler]plot armor[/spoiler] so that wasn't too good, either. 

The bad routes just felt off, too.  One of the choices that makes sense actually leads you to the bad route, which was weird and disappointing.  A lot of the farewell scenes were rather unrealistic, and only [spoiler]the Melody Bad End Route[/spoiler] was actually particularly bad; everything else was neutral.  

There's this entire world out there, and it's barely, barely explored; only the plot-relevant details are mentioned, and some fluff within the routes.  That was disappointing.

The music is nice, but not special.  The sound effects were good, though.  

The art was definitely the saving grace of this piece.  The CGs and sprites are gorgeous.  Enough said.

The smut is...intriguing.  Only [spoiler]Melody's route, again[/spoiler] actually went into it in any detail; every other route cuts off.  What's there is pretty nice to read.  

All in all, this visual novel isn't bad.  What exists is enough to interest.  The single failing of this piece is that there is a lot of potential to create an emotionally thrilling VN...and that potential is only scratched at in this story.

It's not special, and, as a result, simply isn't worth $15 dollars.

23149091.review:
So, I just finished the game and feel kinda obliged to write a small review about it.

First of all, the most important aspect for a VN: The story.

Quite simple, yet refreshing and interesting. The fundament is solid and enjoyable. Only problem I see is its shallowness due to fast and superficial pacing and writing. With its 10-14 hours playtime it's by far not one of the longest and most detailed VNs. It manages to convince you nonetheless, as long as you dont expect too much detail. 

Secondly: The characters.

Whats brings the story to life are its inhabitants and Starlight got a small, but nice and loveable cast. The main heroine is easy to understand and follow, and takes you into her world quite easily. Furthermore, the three love interests are enjoyable and realistic. Once again, a little more depth wouldnt hurt, but you can still get into them.

Thirdly: The music.

Here does SV shine the most. The music is on point and well made. Enhances the atmosphere perfectly and gives each scene alot more depth and feeling. 

Lastly: The scenery/visual composition:

Not out of this world, but also not too shabby. It fulfills it duty and gives you a visual impression of the story and its characters. Though there are not many background sceneries, each of them is detailed and provides a good atmosphere. 

Facit: In terms of yuri visual novels one of the best I've read so far and a must-buy for yuri fans, but "only" an above avarage in terms of general VN's.

22725338.review:
1.
시작으로, 주인공 Aria는 유산으로 물려 받은 외할아버지의 낡은 집에 이사를 오게 되고, 새 집의 서재에서 red-haired demon girl (Lyria)과 만나게 됩니다. 이 만남의 과정에서 Lyria와 Aria는 lifestone에 의해 서로의 soul essence가 연결되어버리는 저주?에 걸리고, Lyria가 원래 있던 이세계 Vega로 돌아가기 위해서, 그리고 마법서의 비밀을 풀고 lifestone 문제도 해결하기 위한 이야기가 전개됩니다.

2-1.
도전과제 목록을 보면 알 수 있듯이, 이 게임은 세 명의 히로인을 공략 할 수 있고 하렘 엔딩도 존재합니다. 각 엔딩의 이야기 전개 범위 때문에 Lyria > Melody > Scherza > Harem 순서로 진행하기를 추천하고, 플레이 타임은 중복 대사를 스킵하지 않을 경우 4-5시간/엔딩 정도 입니다. 나쁘지 않은 볼륨이고, 각 루트의 내용도 충실하게 공략 히로인을 중심으로 전개되어 있습니다.

2-2.
네 종류의 엔딩을 모두 다 보고 도전과제도 다 끝냈는데, 저는 Scherza 엔딩이 가장 좋았습니다. 1) Melody는 정말 좋은 아이에요. 수줍음이 많고 조용한 Melody가 갑자기 적극적으로 Melody x Aria로 전개되는 모습에 조금 놀랐지만, 어쨌건. 엔딩도 가장 무난하고 현실적인 안정감과 설득력을 줍니다. 2) 또, Scherza도 정말 좋은 캐릭터입니다. 이게 이야기 볼륨이 그리 길지 않아서 그렇지, Scherza의 과거와 현재를 제대로 전개했으면 아주 훌륭한 얀데레(혹은 クレイジーサイコレズ)가 만들어 질 수 있었을텐데.... 아 너무 아쉽네요. 어쨌건, 중후반까지의 Scherza의 귀여움과 츤데레로 기대되는 모습들을 보이다가, 적극적으로 Scherza x Aria로 전개가 됩니다. 3) Lyria 루트도 재미있긴 했었는데, Melody와 Scherza 루트를 하고서 다시 떠올려보니 너무 왕도의 내용이었나 싶기도 하고, 그렇네요. 
즉, 이 게임은 Aria를 総受け로 모든 커플링이 이루어집니다. 

2-3.
게임 열람에 생일 인증이 필요한걸보니 연령제한 게임인 것 같은데, 다행히도 단순 H씬 목적의 야겜은 아닙니다. 오히려 그런 목적으로 게임에 관심이 있다면 구매를 말리겠습니다. 한 루트에 한 두번은 내용이 나오기는한데, 수위만이 아니라 내용 자체가 여성향 15금 순정만화와 유사합니다. 저에게는 득이었습니다. 

3.
아쉬운 점으로,
CG가 빈약합니다. 특히 환경 CG의 중복이 너무 많아서, 정보 습득을 전적으로 텍스트에만 의존해야합니다. 하다못해 기본 배경은 동일하더라도 key가 되는 물건이 있으면 그거라도 추가 했으면 합니다. 
그리고, 하렘 엔딩의 마무리가 마음에 안듭니다. 이건 개인의 취향문제일 수 있어서 조심스럽네요. 

[b]4. 종합[/b]
이 게임 원래 가격이 16,000원이고, 저는 발매 세일로 14,000원에 샀습니다. 그냥 비주얼 노벨을 하기 위해서 이 가격으로 이 게임을 구매를 한다면 그저 그럴 것 같습니다. 내용에 어마어마한 비밀이 숨겨져있다거나 전투씬 또는 H씬이 자극을 주고 그런게 아니라서요. 반면에 百合를 찾아 갈 곳 없이 헤매이는 불쌍한 영혼2라면 매우 추천합니다. 가볍게 즐길 수 있는 내용에, 이야기 전개는 유리토피아의 그것과 흡사한 여성향의 성질을 지니고 있습니다. 
이미 발매한 유명작의 번역판이 나오는 것도 좋지만 이와 같은 새로운 게임들도 스팀에 많이 나왔으면 좋겠어요.

22571123.review:
Starlight Vega developed by Razzart Visuals and published onto steam by Sekai Project comes a yuri visual novel as you play as Aria and romance the two sultry demon girls, Lyria and Scherza, or your best friend Melody in this yuri  visual novel where your choices will ultimately decide the fate of this spellbound girl.

[h1]The story[/h1]
You play as Aria, a girl who moves into her grandfather’s old house. While exploring the upstairs study one night, she and her friend Melody accidentally unleash a flirtatious demon named Lyria, who spent the past fifty years in a stone. After freeing her from her prison, the two become attached by a ‘lifestone’, which means Lyria can’t go far from Aria without feeling repercussions, and vice versa. Now Aria, an ordinary highschool girl, must find a way to free herself from Lyria, who seems to crave the exact opposite. Add to that the increasingly realistic dreams plaguing Aria, the sexual tension between Aria and a select few girls around her, and the supernatural phenomena – it seems like Aria’s life will never be the same again.

The story overall is interesting but I was not captivated by it and it has failed to immerse me into the story because the individual routes each has their weak points in terms of there were some important points that were not explored on that individual route, for example 1 of the routes did not explain or even hinted of how Lyria got trapped in the stone. I am not sure which route is that. Apparently among all the character routes I liked the harem ending the most it felt more interesting than the other “good routes” as it touches on almost every topic and the characters in harem ending has more “backbone”they all group together and fought “Reid”.

Character wise I like Scherza: Current Queen of the demon realm. She has a very icy personality and little like for humans. The pacing her route is alright it is not to fast or slow. The main reason I liked her from the start is provably because of her looks and character design she fits into the character personality perfectly, she looks so intimidating and “royal like”.

[h1]Audio and Visual elements[/h1]
[b]Visual Elements –[/b]The visual elements is provably the most distinctive feature in the particular visual novel [well for me] I absolutely adore the artwork and art style being used in this visual novel and it is very consistent with character sprites,  not to mention the backgrounds are very beautiful as it compliments nicely with the overall art style.

[b]Audio Elements –[/b] The music sets the mood for every situation, but it is not memorable and did not leave an impact on me. I think they could have done better for the music because I felt that certain soundtracks was repeated too many times and some were just plain boring.

[h1]To Sum Up [/h1]
To sum up do I recommend this visual novel? Simple answer, yes. People who likes yuri will definitely enjoy Starlight Vega as it is very heavily yuri themed and the romance does not feel forced. Something else worth mentioning is that for the yuri scenes they are all very descriptive and detailed, overall an enjoyable read from the start to finish.

[i]I have been provided a review copy for Starlight Vega but it has no impact on this review in any way.[/i]

[url=https://azusantiara.com/2016/04/23/starlight-vega-review/]Click here for a review with images etc[/url]

22519313.review:
Здравствуйте, друзья! В этот тёплый весенний день позвольте мне поделиться с вами некоторыми моими мыслями и эмоциями касательно данной визуальной новеллы, и, не тратя больше времени, начнём:
I. С самого начала мне следует обозначить для вас два важных положения относительно Starlight Vega, а именно то, что игра полностью на английском языке, и о переводе пока ни слухом ни духом (я во всяком случае), это раз, и два - это юри-новелла, что подразумевает возможность завести главным героем-девушкой романтические отношения  с персонажами исключительно женского пола (других тут практически и нет). Итак, прояснив основополагающие моменты, двигаемся дальше.
II. По моей маленькой традиции начну с рисовки, как с визитной карточки, "лица" любой новеллы. Она мне понравилась практически во всех моментах: CG, BG, спрайты - всё справлено на ура, с душой, чувствуется, что художник подошёл к своему делу с большой охотой и старанием. Радует большое разнообразие эмоций у спрайтов и множество CG. Единственная даже не то чтобы ложка дёгтя лично для меня, это то, что в рисовке спрайтов чувствуется некая ... неловкость что ли, скромность. А может мне просто креститься надо. 
III. Сюжет вначале может показаться тривиальным: главная героиня вместе со своей мамой получает в наследство старинный дом. Вскоре после въезда во время осмотра дома Ария (ГГ) вместе с подругой обнаруживает таинственную комнату, полную древних фолиантов и странных предметов. Героиня дотрагивается до одного из них (а может не дотрагивается? выбор ваш), и с этого начинаются её приключения. Должен признать, что сюжет меня завлёк, и вёл до самого конца, и в этом заслуга качественно прописанных диалогов, истории, и стиля написания в целом, но не только. Об этом далее.
IV. Музыкальное сопровождение. Очень понравилось, музыка подобрана точно в тему, будь то ситуация или персонаж (да-да, у персонажей есть темы). Бывало, что во время чтения я останавливался просто для того, чтобы послушать звучащую композицию, вот такой бонус к погружению она даёт. Надо будет поискать отдельно.
V. Цена. Вот то, что как ничто другое отваживает людей от приобретения этого произведения в обычное, нераспродажное время. Скажу за себя, совсем не хотел брать даже с 10-процентной скидкой, однако взглянув на скриншоты и отзывы, перекрестившись купил. Не пожалел, как видите, а впрочем и так никогда не жалею. Однако ваши кошельки - это ваши кошельки, и решение тоже ваше. Я поддержал разработчика, и рад этому.
VI. В заключение хотелось бы сказать, что оценок я ставить не собираюсь, однако РЕКОМЕНДУЮ эту новеллу всем любителям и не только, и помните, что это моё личное мнение, у вас же обязательно сложится своё, и это замечательно! До встречи в следующих обзорах!

22478558.review:
One of the few rare lesbian visual novels that are already translated, or in this case made for a english audience. 

The Art is interesting, very much a western style, though admittedly it appears that the person who drew the standard interaction CGs and the one who does the more intimate ones was totally different. The latter being far more high quality, which is not necessarily a bad thing, but it can get a bit distracting. I imagine this had something to do with more funding. 

Overall the story is fairly simple and choices in the game do make a impact on the various endings you get, and even make sense in most ways in terms of how they turn out. Unfortunately the love scenes are fairly short and the nudity is lighthearted, seemingly designed for either for all ages or tastefulness as some people might say. 

Still quite a good read and recommended to anyone who's into visual novels and particularly those that like Yuri.

22467970.review:
If you have any amount of interest in yuri, buy this. Yes, it's worth the full price of $15 USD. Just buy it.


Starlight Vega is a fairly light hearted love comedy with LOTS of yuri in it. Just subtext? No! This is 100% bona fide yuri with love confessions, kissing, and PG-13 love scenes. (I would still not play this in front of your parents.) Art-wise, it's adequate enough. It's not bad, just adequate. Soundtrack is enough to set the mood. A single run through can easily be done under 7 hours depending on how fast you read. A complete run with old scene skipping took me 12 hours for all endings. Now for the nitpickings.

[u][b]There MAY be some slight spoilers. Read the next paragraph at your own discretion.[/b][/u]





PLOT

[u]Almost 4th ending exclusive:[/u]

There are definitely moments of [i]"it's magic I ain't gotta explain shit"[/i] going on. Sometimes there are story transitions where it may feel a tad forced. This becomes pretty apparent in the unlocked ending with the way the antagonist is disposed of. Wait a gosh darn minute, we had such a pain in the rear time dealing with this twerp in every other route and all of a sudden it's [spoiler]Persona style All Out Attack on the jerk. All of a sudden everyone but the MC just figured out the quickest way to get rid of curse was to beat the living undead shit out of a malevolent spirit. What da hell?[/spoiler] You girls just reconcile out of the blue ridiculously quickly. For one thing, Scherza's [spoiler]abandonment issue[/spoiler] was only really addressed in Lyria's route where she finally learned [spoiler]what really happened 50 years ago.[/spoiler] Even in Scherza's route, she's one heck of an ice queen to woo. The only times Aria really ever interact with Scherza one on one was [spoiler]in a dream when they haven't been kidnapped to Vega.[/spoiler] There have been instances where she does talk with Aria in a more private fashion, but nothing as deep as whatever happened in Scherza's own route enough for Scherza to get romantically interested in Aria...? To sum it up, the 4th ending just seems to parachute in from out of nowhere. There ARE attempts at trying to make this work, but the progress at how we arrived at this point just seems loosely held together by... [spoiler]harem[/spoiler] anime logic. Yes, Kickstarter incentive and etc. I really enjoyed it but it could've done with more polishing.

[u]Choices[/u]

Yes, there are choices. Choices that easily dictate which route you are going to end up on and some do seemingly absolutely nothing. For all the choices, I wish at there are things I can do more of. Ok, the bracelet in the study. It was briefly brought up and [i]never[/i] heard from again. Could've been funny if that was somehow used. The whole thing between Lyria and Scherza was unfortunately only properly addressed in Lyria's route. Aria has no say whatsoever regarding what actually transpired even though she may have come across the diary and whatever Lyria told her. She has 0 influence whatsoever as a main character and I find that very unfortunate as I do want the two of them to get along. 

[u]Characters[/u]

I adore the characters: Aria, Melody, Lyria, Scherza, and Rhihannon. I'm tempted to say Aria has some issues as a MC, but I've seen much worse performance from otome games so I guess she got [i]just[/i] enough done. I feel for Melody, a lot. She really got the shaft in not her endings. Such a good trooper and super friend. Lyria is just Lyria, fairly straight forward. Scherza is a slight mixed bag due to her behaviors in her own route and whatever happened in the 4th ending. The antagonist is... weeeeeaaaaak. Not enough build up.[i] OOoooh, sinister silhouette. That should totally be enough to give it away.[/i] Not quite. I want to dig in into whatever happened back then. It's all just he says vs she says. Seriously, was it really as bad as it was thought or was there enough room for different interpretations? Scherza does paint the situation different than what was described by everyone else. More plot points please.



The story definitely had a few hiccup points, but overall it holds together well enough for me to gloss over the minor pitfalls it have. Would I recommend this to anyone interested in yuri game? Absolutely. I would try to sell this to anyone who's open to a light hearted visual novel. I got great milage out of it.




More nitpicks
I need more save slots though. There just isn't enough for every choice in every route. 
Please check your grammar and spelling again. There are definitely a few mistakes. I think there is also some coding issue in the special thanks section where someone' name shows up as 4 rectangles... I get there are a LOT of people who donated in the Kickstarter, but that's quite the speed at which you are scrolling...
Not everyone plays visual novel on a daily basis. Nowhere was it mentioned that CONTROL key equals fast forwarding. Interface is already incredibly bare boned and could do with that option instead of relying on the keyboard.
Some bugs with the CG not saving properly in the gallery.

22466900.review:
Starlight Vega is about a girl named Aria. She just moved in to her grandfather's old house along with her mother. Her best friend Melody accompanies her for the night. There they come across a demon, who was trapped in a jewel, named Lyria and an old spell book belonging to her grandfather. They discover that there is a whole other world named Vega, were demons and magic is common place. I don't want to spoil anything so I won't say anymore about the story. 

This is a GxG game. Aria gets to romance Lyria, the sultry demon, Melody, her best friend, and Scherza, a mysterious woman she meets in her dreams. After you complete the game you get the harem route where you can go out with all three of them.

It took me around 6 hours to get through (I skipped read text). So it's not that long.

The overall story is interesting. It has its surprises and you do want to know what is going to happen next but I did feel like the resolution for the problem in Vega was resolved in a very anti-climatic way. Like it just gets solved so easy. I was like, “that's it?”. I also felt like some routes just kinda ended. Also, some of the stuff that happens with Aria's grandparents could have been a bit more in depth. I just wanted to know more about them and what exactly happened in the past that lead to the current events, but that's just my personal opinion. Game does give enough info to get the gist of it.

The actual character routes that dealt with the romance were well done. There's some conflict between the characters that makes things more interesting. In each route you learn something new about the overall plot and everything is revealed little by little as you play all three routes. The harem route seems more like an extra.

To get each character route you are given choices. Some lead to bad endings but it's not that difficult to figure out what you did wrong. I was able to get through this game and get all the achievements without a guide. Just save when there is an important choice.

My favorite character was Scherza, I just like those types of cold characters that warm up as the story goes. At first, I didn't like Lyria much but as I played other routes I also ended up liking her too. I liked Melody too and some parts in her route made me feel bad for her. Aria takes a while to realize things. I liked all the characters, even Sid (who seemed annoying at first but I really liked that little guy as I got to know him better).

The CGs are all well drawn except for one that seemed unfinished like they forgot to finish coloring it or something. It's not big deal but it did bother me a bit. The sprites do look different from the CGs but they are fine, well except that Lyria looks older than in her CGs. There are adult scenes but nothing explicit there is an age verification for reason for this page though. As for the backgrounds, some are more detailed than others. 

I did spot some spelling errors but nothing that heavly distracts from the overall reading experience.

Overall, it's a great game and I recommend it.

22446198.review:
[h1] Starlight Vega is a yuri visual novel. It allows you to make some choices here and there that guide you towards a particular ending, but otherwise you'll be spending your time reading--which is fine, because the story is engaging and complex.  [/h1]

.Story.
It's so difficult to comment on this without spoiling anything, so I'll just say that it's cute and fluffy at times, raunchy and suggestive at others. There's political intrigue, humour, fantasy/magical elements, supernatural elements like ghosts and other realms, combat, romance, non-explicit limes... The list goes on. I imagine there's something here for everyone, especially if you're a fan of reading. 

There were only a few typos, which I greatly appreciated. Thank you for your level of polish, Starlight Vega, you beautiful beast. There are also a couple of plot holes (and one big enough to fall into), but I was so focused on the *adorable* romance that I didn't really mind all that much.

.Game play.
What are you, new here? This is a visual novel. Click your mouse and read the text that appears. 

You can save and load at any point, barring when you're in the middle of making a decision, simply by pressing the right mouse button, which is handy. There's also a gallery for all of the CG you unlike by triggering events in the story or as part of the normal playthrough. 

You can play in full screen or windowed, though I preferred the latter because full screen gives you black bars on the sides.

.Soundtrack.
There was never a moment where I felt as though the music didn't suit what was going on in-game. Romantic scenes featured softer, slower tracks and fight scenes featured upbeat electronic scores. The background music kept me immersed in the story, never drawing away from what was happening, but also making what I read that much more memorable because it was so well-suited. 

Hell, I went to the store while playing to see if the store had the option to purchase the soundtrack separately.

-A minor gripe is that some of the sound effects used for things like gusts of wind and magical attacks sound a little hokey.

.Art style.
The game looks great. Kudos to whoever handled the art.  It's all done in a brightly-coloured anime style, and the backgrounds share the same feel. 

The main character's portrait, which is almost always presented in the bottom left corner of the screen, changes expression depending on what's being said. It's a nice touch and very well detailed. The other characters have a host of different positions and facial expressions that are cycled through, which is another nice touch to make them seem more than just some beautifully-rendered image.

-The backgrounds were pretty limited and, though the game takes place in a variety of settings, you only ever see the same series of images; i.e, the bits where you're at school utilize the same image of the woods that you see when you're at home. Again, this is minor. The backgrounds were still nice to look at, it was just a matter of taking a moment to ground myself in what setting the action had moved to.

.Characters.

There are eight main ones who get detailed portraits. Everone else is just a name on the screen. The cast is varied without fulfilling too many over-used tropes like the emo pretty boy or the girl who wants his attention. Not a single character was annoying, which I find tends to happen a lot with this kind of game. That's a major plus.

Characters include demons, humans, and a wyvern. His name is Sid. He's adorable.

Again, not much to be said here without spoiling anything.

.Bottom line.
If you're in the market for a visual novel, this is definitely worth your money. The game looks good, it's well-written, and you'll get multiple playthroughs out of it. I adore this game. It's one of the better visual novels I've played on Steam; I'm only stopping here because it's very late at night. 

Needless to say, I'm hooked. I whole-heartedly give this game my recommendation.

This is a wonderful Yuri VN. The story is interesting. The art is beautiful.

Despite the scarcity of choices, they have a HUGE impact. Sometimes too big for seemingly small choices. There are multiple significantly different paths. A single playthrough will not cover all the content.

The controls is a problem. There needs to be an options menu for controls or something.
Space advances
Mouse wheel to scroll back and forth (wheel up is go back)
CTRL is skip (really useful for replaying)

Also taking notes is recommended for keeping track of everything. Some paths are difficult and notes are useful for getting these.

Overall this game delivers.

22422494.review:
From the start, I'd just like to say this game is very good. I played it all day long and it was a nice break from life XD. Though there are some things that might be a bit off, Starlight Vega is a very enjoyable visual novel. Now onto the review 

Story 
I find the story to have some very strong points but also some weak ones. The story overall is very interesting from the book, to how Lyria became trapped in stone, and the curse plaguing Vega. My problem though (and this depends on the route) is that thehe story can be weak at times. I think the story stayed pretty strong in Lyria's route. Not only do you find out who Aria's grandpa is, but you also get to know how Lyria came to be in the stone. Same goes for Melody's route to. Where it falls weak though is when we get to the curse and the book itself at times. I sometimes felt like the curse put on Vega wasn't shown enough and wished to feel more of that dread. I admit in Scherza's route that the curse is a bit better played out, but it kind of ends just like that. Still the story was written well and I will give major kudos to how the creator handle the intimate scenes. 

Characters 

One of the best parts of the game and they are what hold the story together. I'll give my thoughts on all of the main five. 

Aria- Our main character. She is an average yet interesting girl who is put into a tough situation. I'll say Aria is pretty likable. She has a personality and tries her best to deal with all these new things thrown at her. I admit sometimes I kind of wish she had more of a spark, but for what we got I did enjoy her and she made the romance feel true with the girls. 

Lyria- I think the best girl. From the moment I saw her I really did enjoy her personality and flirtatious, yet sometimes forceful attitude. Her route I believe was the strongest and I felt Aria and she were the best match. What I liked most about her route was the pacing with the romance. It felt very genuine and the pair had good chemistry. Also her story felt the most complete and I kind of wish the bad guy was in all of the routes since it made more sense. If I had to pick something I didn't like....well I can't think of it XD. Lyria was really a good and well thought out character. My fav to. 

Melody- Aria's best friend. From the moment I saw this girl's design I knew what she'd be like and I was right. Now don't get me wrong, Melody is a good character and the type of friend I'd want. I admit though she was the most boring of the three, but don't get me wrong, I still liked her character. Her love and care for Aria was really sweet and though I found her route to be the less interesting of the three, I did care for her. Only thing is I think she'd be better as a friend to Aria, but that's just me. Her route was cute though and she really has some beautiful CG's

Scherza-I'll admit, I was a bit surprised by this character. I knew she'd be the cold demon and some may find her not too likable. However Scherza, especially in her own route, shows a great deal of sadness and loneliness through the story due to the events in the past. What surprised me even more was she wasn't a Tsun type character despite being cold. In fact I really felt for the girl in all the routes. Her relationship with Aria was done pretty well to and that last CG in her route is pretty amazing. I did feel like Scherza was the second best matched for Aria to. Some points I didn't like about her route was how sometimes it felt rushed. Though the curse is touched upon more and you do feel sorry for Vega, I wished that it was a bit longer to show more of the problem Vega was facing But the creator did do a good job with pacing in her route, so it's not that big of a problem 

Sid- At first I hated this little guy, but he does grow on you. I can't say much without spoiling anything, but I'll tell you that you will feel sorry for him as you read. 

Art

Art is Starlight Vega is very good. I love how the sprites have  unique style. I admit I wish they had some more outfit variations. It was odd to go from sprites and then to CGs where the girls are wearing something entirely different. Still the sprites are very well done. 

CGs are exceptional. Every single one was done very well and I'll tell you I'll be looking back at them XD. If you can save them do, because Razz did an awesome job. 


Backgrounds are pretty good to. I admit some are better then others, but I never got put off by any. I think the demon castle had some of the best backgrounds. I do think that the castle bed rooms needed just small variations as well, but that's a minor thing. 

Music 

Music is good. Some songs may be a bit off putting, but overall the track was nice hearing. I never turned it off.

Closing Notes 

Starlight Vega is a very good and  fun visual novel. It's the first one I've played straight through in a while. The characters, art and story are overall great and I thank the creator for doing a GxG visual novel that can be enjoyed by all people and not just a certain group. Another thing I appreciate is how she handled the intimate scenes. They are done very well and I feel like if she did a more adult game she'd handle them well. 

Anyway if you're looking for a fun, pure GxG, romance story this is it. The price is far and I think you'll have a good time reading it I know I did =). 

Rating-8/10

39490910.review:
Review originally posted on [url=https://www.backlog-assassins.net/posts/w795ewl]here[/url].

7.5/10

Starlight Vega is a wlw VN that nicely balances story, romance, and spice. You play as Aria, a young woman who moves into her grandfather’s old house. She doesn’t know much about him, but she never could have guessed that the gem he was hiding in his study held a demon inside! That gem becomes fused with Aria’s body, binding her to Lyria, the demon. Aria, her best friend Melody, and Lyria have to work to find a way to remove the gem - and then get Lyria home.

This is a finely made VN - the sprites are appealing, the CGs are plush and well done, the writing is fun and bouncy and lively. Aria has three romance options - Melody, Lyria, and Lyria’s sister, Scherza - that are all different and all well done. The love scenes - which you can choose to turn on or off from the settings menu - are spicy without being ultra-explicit, and they’re tender and sweet and loving which is all that I give a shit about.
